member.summary: The default configuration options for a kernel.

member.name: M:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.ImplicitSelfBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic self-binding is enabled.
member.remarks: If , when a type without any bindings is requested from the kernel, the kernel will automatically generate an implicit self-binding for the type if it can be self-bound. If , the kernel will throw an exception when a type with no bindings is requested.

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.GenerateDebugInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the kernel should generate debugging information for bindings and activation contexts.
member.remarks: This adds information to the error message that is displayed if there is a problem during binding or activation at the expense of additional overhead.

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.InjectNonPublicMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether non-public members should be injected by the kernel during activation.
member.remarks: If , the kernel will examine non-public (private, protected, and internal) members for injection. If , only public members will be considered.

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.UseEagerActivation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether types with restricted instantation (i.e. singletons, one-per-threads, etc.) should be eagerly activated.
member.remarks: If , the kernel with activate these instances immediately when bindings are registered for them. If , the instances will be lazily activated the first time they are requested.

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.IgnoreProviderCompatibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the kernel should throw an exception if a provider returns an instance of a type that is not compatible with the requested service.
member.remarks: If , the kernel will throw an if a provider returns an instance of a type that does not extend or implement the requested service. If , the kernel will continue to activate the instance as normal, but may throw an if an activation strategy does not correct the incompatibility (via a proxy, for example).

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.DefaultBehaviorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the built-in behavior that should be used for services registered without a behavior defined.
member.remarks: By default, the kernel will use the .

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.InjectAttributeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute type that will control injections. The kernel will look for members decorated with attributes of the specified type and inject them with values as applicable.
member.remarks: By default, the kernel will look for members decorated with .

member.name: P:Ninject.Core.KernelOptions.OptionalAttributeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the attribute type that will indicate optional injections.
member.remarks: By default, the kernel will look for members decorated with .
